name: Let's get Quizzical | Mixed 20 Questions | 20 Questions

questions.text: In the television show 'Thunderbirds', who were the puppets Scott, Virgil, Alan, Gordon and John named after?
questions.correct: Five of the Project Mercury Astronauts
options: Sons of Gerry Anderson from previous marriages
The top five boy's names in a 1963 poll
questions.explanation: Five of the Project Mercury Astronauts.

questions.text: Which shark is a voracious omnivore and eats virtually anything, including mammals, birds, fish, invertebrates, refuse and man?
What relationship does Louis Molloy have with Natalie Appleton, Ian Wright, Paul Ince, David Beckham and Spice Girl Mel C?
Who said: 'I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception'?
What was the name of the 60 foot yacht that sailing heroine Ellen MacArthur used to become the fastest woman to sail solo around the world in?
Which TV programme features a house with the fictional address of 34 Claremont Avenue, London?
After 'Candle in the Wind' by Elton John (1997) selling 4.9 million records, what is the next best selling single in Britain?
questions.correct: Do they know its Christmas (1984) Band Aid
questions.explanation: Do they know its Christmas (1984) Band Aid.

questions.text: How many pints does a ten gallon hat hold?
Logorrhoea is excess ... ?
Who was murdered by Fitzurse, de Tracy, de Morville and Le Breton?
In what town were Diana Dors and Melinda Messenger born?
At which university did comedic actors Rick Mayall and Ade Edmondson meet and team up?
What was the biggest British TV audience of 39 million viewers for?
options: England's 1966 Football World Cup final with West Germany

questions.text: Excluding English, what is the most widely spoken European language in the world?
Who said: 'Bigamy is having one husband too many, Monogamy is the same'?
questions.explanation:
Erica Jong.

	Erica Jong said this in 'Fear of Flying' (1973)

questions.text: Who said: 'I only went into cookery because I'm an alcoholic'?
Whose autobiography is 'It doesn't take a hero'?
What make of car was barmy Basil Fawlty giving a damn good thrashing to in a classic episode of Fawlty Towers?
Which football (soccer) team was Lennie Lawrence the manager of that included a Chinese International player?
The 'Eternity' board game puzzle (that offered a lot of money to the person who completed it first) had how many pieces?
